testTitle: UK Driving Theory Test - Highway Code
testDescription: Practice questions covering UK Highway Code rules, road signs, and driving regulations.

questions.stem: What does a circular blue sign with a white arrow pointing left mean?
questions.explanation: A circular blue sign with a white arrow indicates a compulsory direction. All traffic must follow the direction shown by the arrow.

questions.stem: What is the national speed limit on a dual carriageway for cars?
questions.explanation: The national speed limit for cars on dual carriageways is 70 mph, the same as on motorways.

questions.stem: When should you use hazard warning lights?

options.label: When your vehicle has broken down

questions.explanation: Hazard warning lights should be used when your vehicle is stationary and causing an obstruction or danger to other road users.

questions.stem: You must NOT sound your horn between what hours in a built-up area?
questions.explanation: You must not sound your horn in a built-up area between 11:30 PM and 7:00 AM, except in emergency situations.

questions.stem: A red triangle warning sign shows there is a steep hill ahead.
questions.explanation: Red triangular warning signs alert drivers to hazards ahead. A steep hill sign shows the percentage gradient (e.g., 20% or 1 in 5).
